prompt:
---
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs: 
  text:
    type: string
---
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below. First extract all company names, then extract all people names, then extract specific topics which fit the content and finally extract general overarching themes

Desired format:
Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
People names: -||-
Specific topics: -||-
General themes: -||-

Text: {{text}}
inputSpec:
The input must be a string containing the text from which elements are to be extracted.  
The input string can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters, punctuation marks, and whitespaces.  
The input should represent a coherent piece of writing or passage where companies, people, topics, and themes may be present.  
The input does not impose specific restrictions on length but should be sufficiently informative for meaningful extraction of entities.
rules: The output must contain a section labeled "Company names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "People names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "Specific topics" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of specific topics relevant to the content of the given text.
The output must contain a section labeled "General themes" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of general overarching themes relevant to the given text.
Each section in the output should be clearly separated and follow the order: Company names, People names, Specific topics, General themes.
If there are no entities to list in any section, the section must still be present, but it should have an empty list following the colon.
inverseRules: Company names must not be extracted from the given text, and no section should be labeled for them.
People names must not be extracted from the given text, and no section should be labeled for them.
Specific topics must not be mentioned in any section labeled with such a title.
General themes must not be listed in any section labeled for them.
Each section in the output should be randomly ordered and not clearly separated.
Sections with no entities should be omitted entirely from the output.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Company names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: Yesterday, IBM and Microsoft announced a joint venture aimed at accelerating AI capabilities.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: IBM,Microsoft
People names: 
Specific topics: AI,Joint Venture
General themes: Technology,Innovation
tests.reasoning: Tests extraction of company names, presence, and correct formatting in output.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Company names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: Apple, Amazon, and Tesla have been major players in recent market shifts due to emerging technologies.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: Apple,Amazon,Tesla
People names: 
Specific topics: Market Shifts,Emerging Technologies
General themes: Business,Innovation
tests.reasoning: Ensures multiple companies are identified and formatted correctly, testing section completeness.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Company names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of company names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: The collaboration between Google and Facebook was documented in the latest tech news.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: Google,Facebook
People names: 
Specific topics: Collaboration,Tech News
General themes: Media,Technology
tests.reasoning: Validates the software can extract company names across different sentence structures.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "People names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: Elon Musk was spotted at the Tesla event along with Bill Gates and Sundar Pichai.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: Tesla
People names: Elon Musk,Bill Gates,Sundar Pichai
Specific topics: Event
General themes: Leadership,Technology
tests.reasoning: Checks that the software accurately identifies and formats people names in the output.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "People names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: The keynote speakers were Tim Cook, Sheryl Sandberg, and Jeff Bezos, discussing future strategies.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names: Tim Cook,Sheryl Sandberg,Jeff Bezos
Specific topics: Keynote,Strategies
General themes: Business,Future
tests.reasoning: Tests function for multiple people names and ensures correct alphabetical order in extraction.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "People names" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of people names extracted from the given text.
tests.testinput: During the conference, CEOs Larry Page, Satya Nadella, and Mark Zuckerberg exchanged insights.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names: Larry Page,Satya Nadella,Mark Zuckerberg
Specific topics: Conference,Insight Exchange
General themes: Networking,Innovation
tests.reasoning: Ensures names are recognized irrespective of their position in the sentence and different contexts.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Specific topics" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of specific topics relevant to the content of the given text.
tests.testinput: The panel discussed renewable energy, sustainability, and eco-friendly products.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names: 
Specific topics: Renewable Energy,Sustainability,Eco-friendly Products
General themes: Environment,Economy
tests.reasoning: Tests are the correct identification and listing of specific topics derived from the text content.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Specific topics" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of specific topics relevant to the content of the given text.
tests.testinput: In medical news, the topics highlighted were gene editing, immunotherapy, and telemedicine.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names: 
Specific topics: Gene Editing,Immunotherapy,Telemedicine
General themes: Health,Technology
tests.reasoning: Checks accurate extraction across multiple detailed topics domains in medical context.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "Specific topics" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of specific topics relevant to the content of the given text.
tests.testinput: The curriculum includes cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and quantum computing courses.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names:

General themes: Education,Technology

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "General themes" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of general overarching themes relevant to the given text.
tests.testinput: The universal impact of climate change and economic fluctuations are seldom disputed.
tests.expectedoutput:
Company names: 
People names: 
Specific topics: Climate Change,Economic Fluctuations
General themes: Environment,Economics
tests.reasoning: Tests for general themes by extracting broader concepts that are implied subjects of the passage.

tests.rule: The output must contain a section labeled "General themes" followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of general overarching themes relevant to the given text.

tests.expectedoutput:
Company names:

General themes: Culture,Communication

tests.expectedoutput:
Company names:

General themes: Industry,Workforce Transformation

tests.rule: Each section in the output should be clearly separated and follow the order: Company names, People names, Specific topics, General themes.

tests.rule: Each section in the output should be clearly separated and follow the order: Company names, People names, Specific topics, General themes.

tests.testinput:
Company names: Apple, Google  
People names: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai  
Specific topics: innovation, technology advancement  
General themes: corporate growth, leadership  
  
Text: In recent news, Tim Cook from Apple and Sundar Pichai from Google discussed their plans for innovation and technology advancement. The discussion emphasized corporate growth and leadership.

Company names: Microsoft, Amazon  
People names: Satya Nadella, Jeff Bezos  
Specific topics: cloud computing, e-commerce expansion  
General themes: digital transformation, global market presence  
  
Text: During a global conference, Satya Nadella, CEO of Microsoft, and Jeff Bezos, former CEO of Amazon, highlighted the importance of cloud computing and e-commerce expansion. The themes revolved around digital transformation and maintaining a global market presence.

Company names: Tesla, SpaceX  
People names: Elon Musk  
Specific topics: electric vehicles, space exploration  
General themes: sustainability, technological innovation  
  
Text: Elon Musk, who is associated with Tesla and SpaceX, spoke about the future of electric vehicles and space exploration. The central discussions were centered on sustainability and technological innovation.

Company names: Facebook, Instagram  
People names: Mark Zuckerberg  
Specific topics: social media impact, user privacy  
General themes: digital communication, privacy challenges  
  
Text: Mark Zuckerberg, leading Facebook and Instagram, delved into the implications of social media impact on society and issues surrounding user privacy. The conversation focused on themes of digital communication and privacy challenges.

Company names: IBM, Intel  
People names: Arvind Krishna, Pat Gelsinger  
Specific topics: artificial intelligence, semiconductor innovation  
General themes: technological advancement, industry collaboration  
  
Text: Arvind Krishna, CEO of IBM, and Pat Gelsinger, CEO of Intel, announced a partnership aimed at pushing the frontiers of artificial intelligence and semiconductor innovation. The collaboration fosters themes of technological advancement and industry collaboration.

Company names: Netflix, Walt Disney  
People names: Reed Hastings, Bob Chapek  
Specific topics: streaming services, content creation  
General themes: entertainment industry, consumer engagement  
  
Text: Reed Hastings from Netflix and Bob Chapek from Walt Disney engaged in discussions about the evolution of streaming services and content creation. The general themes were entertainment industry dynamics and consumer engagement strategies.

Company names: PayPal, Stripe  
People names: -  
Specific topics: online payments, fintech growth  
General themes: digital economy, financial technology  
  
Text: Companies like PayPal and Stripe are leading the charge in online payments, driving significant growth in the fintech arena. The overarching discussion revolved around the digital economy and advancements in financial technology.

Company names: Pfizer, Moderna  
People names: Albert Bourla, Stéphane Bancel  
Specific topics: vaccine development, public health  
General themes: healthcare innovation, global health initiatives  
  
Text: Albert Bourla, representing Pfizer, and Stéphane Bancel from Moderna discussed vaccine development as part of ongoing efforts to address public health challenges. The themes covered healthcare innovation and global health initiatives.

Company names: Oracle, SAP  
People names: Larry Ellison, Christian Klein  
Specific topics: enterprise solutions, software integration  
General themes: business efficiency, software innovation  
  
Text: Larry Ellison of Oracle and Christian Klein of SAP unveiled new enterprise solutions designed to enhance business efficiency and software integration. Discussions were framed around business efficiency strategies and ongoing software innovation.

Company names: Twitter  
People names: Jack Dorsey  
Specific topics: social networking, community engagement  
General themes: digital interaction, social connectivity  
  
Text: In a recent interview, Jack Dorsey elaborated on Twitter's role in shaping social networking and community engagement. The broader discussions underscored themes of digital interaction and social connectivity.
